messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: eBay Seller
messages.msgSnippet: I would suggest going to Pat Simone s mastersword53777@yahoogroups.com list, if one is desirous of obtaining candid reviews of Ebay sellers. ... From:
messages.messageBody:
I would suggest going to Pat Simone's mastersword53777@yahoogroups.com list, if one is desirous of obtaining candid reviews of Ebay sellers.
----- Original Message -----
From: kidjapan2003
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, February 15, 2004 3:47 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: eBay Seller


--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Peter Farrar" <pcfarrar@b...>
wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Does anyone know who the seller is on eBay going by the handle
> katana.jap It says he is from Kobe Japan.
>
> I was thinking of bidding on one of his items.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Peter

I am a beginner and have jusr bought a couple of mons-related tsubas
from this guy. What is the opinion on this piece please?
Thank you Paul

http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/vwp?.dir=/kidjapan&.
src=gr&.dnm=monstsubaII.jpg&.view=t&.done=http%

messages.subject: Re: eBay Seller
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Peter, I ve bought 2 tsubas from him ~2 months ago and they are fine. The transaction was quick anyway, I didn t have any problems. But Rich and Lou are
messages.messageBody:
Hi Peter,

I've bought 2 tsubas from him ~2 months ago and they are fine. The
transaction was quick anyway, I didn't have any problems. But Rich
and Lou are right: you should ask him directly, and do not trust his
opinion on schools, age etc.

Regards,
Stan

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Peter Farrar" <pcfarrar@b...>
wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Does anyone know who the seller is on eBay going by the handle
> katana.jap It says he is from Kobe Japan.
>
> I was thinking of bidding on one of his items.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Peter

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] eBay Seller
messages.msgSnippet: Peter, Don t trust his attributions to particular schools.  He is usually wrong. Lou [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
Peter,
Don't trust his attributions to particular schools. He is usually wrong.


Lou


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] eBay Seller
messages.msgSnippet: ... I have bought from him successfully. I have head of other people receiving repro goods. It might be worthwhile on anything you go for, to ask up front if
messages.messageBody:
<pcfarrar@...> writes:

> Hi,
> Does anyone know who the seller is on eBay going by the handle
> katana.jap It says he is from Kobe Japan.

> I was thinking of bidding on one of his items.

I have bought from him successfully. I have head of other people
receiving repro goods. It might be worthwhile on anything you go for, to
ask up front if it is a repro or not and get his response on file.

Well, in general, this is a good thing to do with any seller you don't
know yet.

- darcy

messages.subject: Re: eBay Seller
messages.msgSnippet: ... He is a Frenchman living in Japan. Some of his goods (tsuba) are ok, some have been burned and refinished, some are repros. Ask lots of detailed questions
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, samurai@x wrote:
> <pcfarrar@b...> writes:
>
> > Hi,
> > Does anyone know who the seller is on eBay going by the handle
> > katana.jap It says he is from Kobe Japan.

He is a Frenchman living in Japan. Some of his goods (tsuba)
are ok, some have been burned and refinished, some are
repros. Ask lots of detailed questions of the dealer on
the item you're thinking about; especially about condition,
authenticity (period) and whether it has been burned or not.

Rich S

Hi,

Does anyone know who the seller is on eBay going by the handle
katana.jap It says he is from Kobe Japan.

I was thinking of bidding on one of his items.

Thanks,

Peter
